results.title: Song of Ceylon
results.creator_credit: GPO Film Unit, John Grierson and Basil Wright
results.brief_description: A poetic interpretation of the life and customs of the people of Ceylon, showing the contrast between the culture of the Singalese of the island, and the western economic outlook. One of the most famous of the GPO Film Unit’s productions, this film helped to build the reputation of the British documentary film movement. ‘The Song of Ceylon’ is in four sections, 1. The Buddha, 2. The Virgin island, 3. The Voice of commerce, 4. The Apparel of God. Sponsored by the Ceylon Tea Propaganda Board. Music by Walter Leigh. Photographed by Basil Wright.

results.title: Son of Lassie
results.creator_credit: S. Sylvan Simon, Samuel Marx and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Introduced by Bill Collins, “Son of Lassie” is a sequel to “Lassie come home”, based on some characters from the book “Lassie come home” by Eric Knight. It is set during World War II and tells the story of adventure and loyalty between man and dog - Ken (Peter Lawford) and Laddie, son of everyone’s favourite collie, Lassie. A classic family favourite with a cast including Donald Crisp, June Lockhart, Nigel Bruce.

results.title: Sommersby
results.creator_credit: Jon Amiel, Arnon Milchan, Alcor Films, Regency Enterprises and Studio Canal+
results.brief_description: People remembered Jack Sommersby as a bitter, loutish man but when he returns home after the Civil War, he’s tender, caring and resourceful. Has the war changed him… or is the man calling himself Jack Sommersby an impostor? Richard Gere and Jodie Foster are a match for the ages in Sommersby, a period romance rich in mystery, detail and splendid performances. They portray Jack and Laurel Sommersby, whose love grows as the suspicions about Jack mount. If he isn’t the man she married, Laurel knows he is the man she always wanted, but an ultimate test of their love and Jack’s identity awaits. Jack must stand trial for his life and the outcome makes for a memorable film.

results.title: Solas
results.creator_credit: Benito Zambrano, Antonio P Perez and Maestranza Films
results.brief_description: Thirtysomething Maria lives alone in a squalid quarter of a nameless Spanish city, having fled the rural home of her violent, alcoholic father and long-suffering mother. Embittered and depressed by her family life, her experiences with men, her menial job and her recent discovery that she is pregnant, she finds her only solace in alcohol. After her father is admitted to a nearby hospital she begrudgingly lets her mother stay with her while he recuperates. Although her daughter disdains her for silently tolerating years of abuse by her husband, Maria’s mother is nevertheless warm and loving, and does all she can to brighten her daughter’s life. She also befriends a neighbour in the same apartment block, a desperately lonely old man who quickly becomes attached to her and gives her the respect and affection she never experienced with her husband. Slowly and tentatively, mother and daughter begin to set aside their practiced antagonism and repair the lines of communication in their relationship. Buoyed by her newfound understanding of her mother and her own budding relationship with her elderly neighbour, Maria starts to gain new hope for her future. Highly successful in its home country, “Solas” is sensitively directed, never sliding into sentimentality, and is filled with standout performances from its small cast. Cast includes Ana Fernandez, Maria Galiana and Carlos Alvarez-Novoa. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Snows of Aorangi
results.brief_description: Shows champions Hans Bohny, Harvey Clifford, and Peter Lawlor on a ski run on the slopes of New Zealand’s highest mountain, Mt Cook or Aorangi - “the cloud piercer” as it is known by the Maoris. Includes spectacular scenes of a snow-storm, an avalanche, and strange ice formations.

results.title: Small soldiers
results.creator_credit: Joe Dante, Michael Finnell, Colin Wilson, NBCUniversal and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: When defence industry firm Globotech takes over the small toy company Heartland Play Systems, it makes for some interesting merging of ideas. New CEO Gil Mars (Denis Leary) approves an enhancement to current action figures to make them look more realistic, and gives the task to Heartland employees Larry Benson (Jay Mohr) and Irwin Wayfair (David Cross). This results in the creation of some serious looking fighting figures, appropriately called the Command Elite who wage a constant war against the alien Gorgonites. As a final measure, Benson inserts some of Globotech’s powerful military computer chips into the new toys. In a run down toy store in Ohio, a father and son get to see the new product and decide it’s just what they need to boost their failing business. The son learns to communicate with the leader of the Gorgonites, Archer (voice supplied by Frank Langella), which has serious consequences for their future. It’s not long before the Command Elite burst forth from their packing, led by Chip Hazard (voice supplied by Tommy Lee Jones), ready as ever to do battle with the Gorgonites. When Chip sees the Gorgonite leader communicating with humans, it results in an all out war between the Command Elite and humans in a fantastic mix of live action, animatronics, puppetry and computer animation. Voices from Robert Aldrich’s ‘The Dirty Dozen’ are provided as some of the voices of the Command Elite. Cast also includes Kirsten Dunst and Gregory Smith. Features a tribute to Phil Hartman after the closing credits.

results.title: Sling blade
results.creator_credit: Billy Bob Thornton, David L. Bushell, Brandon Rosser and Shooting Gallery
results.brief_description: Thornton stars as Karl Childers, a simple man who has spent the last 25 years in a mental institution for the murders of his mother and her lover. On the day he is to be released, Karl tells his story to two journalists and we learn the shocking circumstances surrounding the crime. Now out in the world, Karl experiences cruelty from some locals, kindness from others - especially a young boy and his mother, with whom he develops an unlikely friendship. However, when the mother’s abusive boyfriend appears on the scene, Karl is thrust into an explosive predicament that builds to a gripping, unexpected and unforgettable climax. Winner of the 1996 Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay.

results.title: Sliding doors
results.creator_credit: Peter Howitt, William Horberg, Philippa Braithwaite, Sydney Pollack, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Losing her job triggers a strange turn of events for Helen (Gwyneth Paltrow) when she discovers two possibilities for her future. These possibilities are based on the sliding door which signifies whether she catches or misses the train home, and these two scenarios are followed in a parallel sequence. In the world in which she misses her train, Helen works hard at menial jobs to support herself and her unfaithful, writer boyfriend Gerry (John Lynch). In the world in which she catches the train, Helen discovers that getting over discovering Gerry’s infidelity is not as bad as she thought when she begins a relationship with James (John Hannah). Through her happiness however comes unexpected confusion, as nothing is as it seems on the surface. Ultimately the two worlds coalesce, but only one man can accompany her into the future. Cast includes Jean Tripplehorn, Zara Turner and Douglas McFerran.

results.title: Sleepless in Seattle
results.creator_credit: Nora Ephron, Gary Foster and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Tom Hanks stars as a recently widowed architect with a young son who moves to Seattle on the East Coast of America to escape the painful memories of his life with his wife. Meg Ryan is a recently engaged journalist who believes she has found the perfect man in her fiancee. Its Christmas, the silly season and Hanks young son has called a talk-back show to try and help his Dad move on with life. Ryan hears his conversation with the radio announcer who calls him Sleepless in Seattle. His words strike a chord in Ryan who begins to doubt if her comfortable life is really all she wants. Thus begins a story of chance and double-chance and of finding true love. This one of the most enchanting romantic comedies ever created.

results.title: Sleepers
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Steve Golin, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Propaganda Films and Baltimore Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story “Sleepers” is the story of four boyhood friends, growing up in Hells Kitchen, New York, in the 1960s. The boys are depicted as carefree enough, despite an indulgence in petty crime and, in the case of one, watching his mother get beaten by his father. In the summer of 1966 however their lives are altered forever when a prank goes wrong and a man is accidentally killed. The boys are sentenced to one year in a boys home where they are beaten, psychologically abused and raped by male guards. Thirteen years later, as adults, all four men are given an opportunity to avenge their childhood abuse. To do this effectively they must ask many around them to compromise who they are and what they stand for, in particular their childhood priest and confidant Father Bobby. A story of coming of age and of revenge, “Sleepers” was plagued with controversy upon its release as the authenticity of the story was challenged. Starring: Brad Pitt, Jason Patric, Billy Crudup, Kevin Bacon, Ron Eldard, Minnie Driver and Dustin Hoffman. Directed by Barry Levinson (Good Morning, Vietnam, Rainman, Diner, Bandits).
